feat.name: Verduran Shadow Dedication
feat.prerequisites: trained in {@skill Stealth}, trained in {@skill Survival}
entries: Your awareness of primal energies allows you to explore forests with preternatural ease. You become an expert in {@skill Survival}. You can substitute your proficiency in {@skill Survival} for your proficiency in {@skill Stealth} when meeting feat prerequisites and gaining additional benefits from feats for being an expert, master, or legendary in {@skill Stealth}; however, unless you also fulfill the {@skill Stealth} prerequisite, you can only use those feats in forest terrain. While in forests, you can use your {@skill Survival} modifier in place of your {@skill Stealth} modifier when you {@action Avoid Notice}, {@action Hide}, {@action Sneak}, or would use {@skill Stealth} to roll initiative.
special: You can't select another {@trait dedication} feat until you've gained two other feats from the {@archetype Verduran Shadow|WoW1} archetype.

feat.name: Canopy Predator
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Verduran Shadow Dedication|WoW1}, trained in {@skill Athletics}
entries: You are as at home in the treetops as you are beneath their branches. You gain a climb Speed of 15 feet when moving through trees, vines, and other foliage. Whenever you succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Climb} a tree or an {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Balance} on a branch, you get a critical success instead. You aren't {@condition off-guard|PC1} while {@action Climb||Climbing} or {@action Balance||Balancing} on a tree.

feat.name: Underbrush Trailblazer
entries: You gain the {@feat Terrain Stalker} feat, selecting the underbrush terrain; if you already have {@feat Terrain Stalker} for underbrush, you can select a different type of difficult terrain. If you {@action Avoid Notice} while exploring, and if any allies use {@action Follow the Expert} to follow you as you do so, you can extend your {@feat Terrain Stalker} feat's benefits to one ally so long as they remain within 10 feet of you. If you have master proficiency in {@skill Stealth}, you can extend the effect to two allies. If you have legendary proficiency in {@skill Stealth}, you can extend it to four allies.

feat.name: Verduran Ambush
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Verduran Shadow Dedication|WoW1}, expert in {@skill Stealth}
entries: You prepare to ambush a foe. You {@action Ready} an activity that takes 2 actions, though that activity must either be Death from Above or an activity with the requirement that you be {@condition hidden} or {@condition undetected} by all your opponents (such as {@action Scout's Pounce|APG}). After using the reaction, you cannot use this feat again for 10 minutes.

feat.name: Death from Above
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Canopy Predator|WoW1}, {@feat Verduran Shadow Dedication|WoW1}, expert in {@skill Athletics}
feat.requirements: You are standing, {@action climb||climbing}, or {@action balance||balancing} on a surface at least 10 feet above your target.
entries: You leap down on your target, using their body to cushion your fall and your momentum to empower your attack. Attempt an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Leap} to a space adjacent to the target. If you land adjacent to the target, compare the {@skill Athletics} check result against your target's Reflex DC.

When you leap onto a creature in this way, you do not also deal damage for falling on a creature (Player Core 421). Regardless of your result, the target is temporarily immune to your Death from Above for 1 minute.

Critical Success: The target falls and lands {@condition prone}, reducing the falling damage you take by an amount equal to twice your level. You then can make a melee {@action Strike} against the target. The {@action Strike} gains the deadly d8 weapon property and deals an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. This additional damage increases to {@dice 2d6} if you are a master in {@skill Athletics}, and to {@dice 3d6} if you are legendary in {@skill Athletics}.
Success: The target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the beginning of your next turn, reducing the falling damage you take by an amount equal to your level. You can then make a melee {@action Strike} against the target, adding the deadly d8 weapon property to the attack.
Failure: You can make a {@action Strike} against the target.
Critical Failure: You fall {@condition prone}, whether you take falling damage or not.

feat.name: Sense the Strike
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Verduran Shadow Dedication|WoW1}, master in {@skill Survival}
feat.trigger: A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.
entries: You sense how an incoming attack moves through ambient primal energy, predicting how best to dodge. The triggering attack targets your {@skill Survival} DC instead of your AC. Though this allows you to avoid taking penalties to your AC, it doesn't remove any conditions or other effects causing such penalties. For example, an enemy with sneak attack would still deal extra damage to you for being {@condition off-guard|PC1}, even though you wouldn't take the â€“2 circumstance penalty when defending against the attack.
